intro: Siphocampylus pavonis, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers with a distinctive crown-like structure. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open landscapes. Siphocampylus pavonis is adapted to full sun and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy ornamental plant in xeriscaped gardens.
